turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It means "bloodbrother."

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: How does it look?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Not good.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: I want to see the sun rise.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How do you feel?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Like a fucking heifer took a dump in my mouth.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You came back for me.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Did you think I wouldn't?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Took you long enough.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Let's just hope you've kicked the Thirst for good.  I'll be watching you close. You start to back-slide --

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You put a bullet in my brain.  Wouldn't expect anything else.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I agree.  We play along for now, we might wind up learning something about how their world ticks.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Either that or feeding the worms.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Sounds like a plan.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What do you really think?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: These guys are shitting bricks cause they're no longer on the top of the food chain.  They're going to fuck us the first chance they get.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He's right.  They'll smell that you're human.  Stay here, watch our backs.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I don't like it.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I'm not giving you a choice, old man.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I thought you were supposed to be watching our backs.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Ran into a little Reaper trouble myself.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Where were you, Whistler?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I'll show you.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You ask me, you and Miss Muffet are getting a mite too cozy for my taste.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I wouldn't worry about it.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I am worrying.  Seems to me, you're starting to get confused as to which side of the line you're standing on.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Pretty hollow words coming from a man who spent the last year running with the enemy.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It means I'm starting to wonder if the vampires still have their hooks in you. You've been acting strange ever since I gave you the cure.  Reckless, quick to anger --  You said it yourself, Whistler.  Those vampires knew our defense system backwards and forwards.  Where'd they get their intel?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Eau de suckhead.  Tasty.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: We'll split into three units.  First team that makes contact wins the prize. Try to maintain radio silence from here on out.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Your security's for shit, kid.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Where the hell have you been?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Just out connecting a few dots.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What's your problem, Whistler?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Why don't you ask your girlfriend?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I did some checking on that Carter Stevens character.  That familiar of theirs who claimed he was with the NIH? Turns out he used to work for them, but he doesn't anymore.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Then who does he work for?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Come on, Blade.  Talk to me!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Blood...

turns.speaker: REINHARDT
turns.text: And so will we.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Look, I care about the humans who are dying, not you, got it?

turns.speaker: REINHARDT
turns.text: Spare me the race card, OJ.  We're not going out into the sun.  It's too risky.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't have a choice.  You're just going to have to protect yourselves as best you can.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Must be hundreds of these skeletons here.

turns.speaker: REINHARDT
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: So I think you people may have underestimated how many Reapers you're dealing with.

turns.speaker: REINHARDT
turns.text: Put it back in park, Blade.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Thought you were dead.

turns.speaker: REINHARDT
turns.text: Seems like there's a lot of that going around these days.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: It has been said, you may have enemies whom you hate, but not enemies whom you despise.  Be proud of your enemy: then his success shall be yours, too.  In that regard, I should thank you.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You want me to hunt them for you.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Not alone.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: The genetic material you spliced into Nomak --  Where did you get it?

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: I should think that would be obvious at this point.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: True, but thanks to you, we know his weakness.  We can keep him contained. It's just a matter of time before we hunt him down.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Too bad you're out of it.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: And why is that?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Revenge.  That's what Nomak wanted all along.  To pay back the people who created him.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: You got something in mind, Blade?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Ultra-rapid detox.  They use it on heroin addicts, make 'em go cold-turkey in one night.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Gonna try and OD Whistler on a retroviral cure.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: I don't know about this, man --

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Motion sensors.  Looks like Zone Three.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Human?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: So you're going to do this?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.  Isn't that how the saying goes?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He was here.  Watching us.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Nomak?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He wants us to know he's hunting us now.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Kiss your ass goodbye, Reinhardt.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: You're wasting your time, Blade.  The flechette's a dud.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: So that's down and dirty.  Got anything to say for yourself?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Two things.  One, I was on to you the moment they turned you.  And two --  I switched that dud of yours back with the real one.

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: Hey, hey!  The fuck you doing?!

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Getting your attention, Paco.

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: Well you've got it, warmblood.  Now what the fuck are you gonna do with it?

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Like how little?  In case you hadn't noticed, we lost two men while you were out farting around.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You need to ratchet those 'nads of yours down a few notches, paco.

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: Listen, hillbilly, you are a cunt-hair away from cowboy heaven.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Ain't no thing but a chicken wing, buttercup.

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: We want to attract them, not scare them off.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Yeah, but you fangs can see in the dark. What am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: What the fuck you doing?

turns.speaker: CHUPA
turns.text: Ain't nobody here but you and me, chicken wing.  I'd say this is as good a time as any to settle up.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: His name is Jared Nomak.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Thiavolos, as we used to say in Greece. The Devil.  Pure Thirst.  Nothing more. He was born a vampire, but he is an anomaly.  Like you.  Unlike the rest of us, however, he feeds on not just humans, but vampires as well.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: I would hate to think you were losing your perspective.  Who do you think God favors in the web?  The spider or the fly?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Nomak said something to Blade in Greek. Athelfiki singenia ex amato.  Where did he learn that?

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: From his father, of course.

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: You experimented on your own, son?

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: We're locked in.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Are you insane?  He'll kill us both!

turns.speaker: NYSSA
turns.text: Maybe it's better that way.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: They've made contact with the Reapers.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Any casualties?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: Two so far.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: An inevitability, I suppose.  Nyssa was not among them, I trust.

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: No.  This is a dangerous game, you're playing, Damaskinos.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: Any game worthy of being played is.  One must be patient.  In this way, I have outlived my enemies.  All of them.

turns.speaker: DAMASKINOS
turns.text: You worry too much, Stevens.  I have assurance from our friend inside that events are unfolding as scripted.

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: As scripted?  You've already lost two of your own.  How many more are you willing to sacrifice?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: I see from your questionnaire that you don't have any immediate next of kin?

turns.speaker: NOMAK
turns.text: Not that I'm in contact with.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Nobody to call in case of an emergency?

turns.speaker: NOMAK
turns.text: No --  Does that mean I can't be a donor?

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: It depends.  We came up with some unusual results on your blood test.

turns.speaker: NURSE
turns.text: Your blood has a very rare phenotype, one that's quite valuable to people like us.

turns.speaker: NOMAK
turns.text: Us?  What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Tell me something, Skid --

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Scud.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Whatever --  What'd you do to the Charger?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: The pimp-mobile?  Just made a few after market modifications.  Nitrous-oxide injection system, forged aluminum pistons and crankshaft, higher flowing fuel pump.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Gave it a more aggressive exhaust profile ramping.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Fuck yeah.  Whole package'll crank this betty up another three-hundred horsepower.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: And you'll burn the damn thing out before your next fucking oil change.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Where'd you dig up this shit-bird anyway?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Look, what's your problem?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Hey, you think I don't know what's at stake here?  We practically compromised our whole operation to save your puckered old ass!  And for what?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Our operation?!  Our operation?!  I built this operation, you fucking turd stain.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: This whole deal's giving me a serious case of the butt-willies.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Look, kid, they obviously found your base of operations.  If it was a trap, why flip their dicks by announcing themselves?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: The hell are you fiddling with there?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Tweaked the phosphor rod, modified the collimated beam, wanna concentrate the light, get something like a UV laser going.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You're wasting your time, already been tried.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Yeah, but you didn't have the Scudster working on it, did you?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Nope.  Back then we did not.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: So how long have you known Blade, anyway?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Going on twenty years now.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Blade doesn't talk about the old days much.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Blade doesn't talk about anything much.  What about you, though?

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Pretty.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: I was backpacking.  Hooked up with these two chicks who were off to see the Burning Man festival.  We were gonna take "E", have ourselves a little freeball out in the desert.  You know the riff, "Dear Penthouse, I never thought this would happen to me, but --"

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: What about you?  You're not coming?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: After last night?  Dude, I'm a lover, not a fighter.

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Yeah, your little cootchie knew.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You little shit.  When did they get to you?

turns.speaker: SCUD
turns.text: Back when Blade had me hunting down your puckered old ass.  What's up with your hair, anyway?  Fucking Willie Nelson look-a-like?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Whistler!

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Are we bringing home strays now?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: She's been bitten.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: You should've killed her, then.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: She hasn't turned yet.  You can help her.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I had to increase the dose. You're building up a resistance to the serum --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Just do it, old man.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Stupidity.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Maybe not. I did some checking, she's a hematologist. Knowledge like that might come in handy.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It's not worth the risk. We can't trust her.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Get in. YouÂ’re leaving.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: What took you so long?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Don't even start, old man.

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Going somewhere?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: China Town. I need more serum.  What's all this?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Don't try to talk --

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: Listen. You have to -- finish me off. You don't want me coming back.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: No, we can treat the wounds --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Whistler, I --

turns.speaker: WHISTLER
turns.text: I know.  Just be quick about it, will you? Do it right.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Beautiful day, isn't it?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How can you be out here?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: I dabble in pharmaceuticals, medical research. We've developed a type of sun-blocker using octyl salicylate, a few others things.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: It's not very effective in direct sunlight, but it's a start. The goal, of course, is to be like you, "the Day-walker".

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I don't buy it.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Why not? The future of our race runs through your bloodstream. You've got the best of both worlds, Blade. All of our strengths and none of our weaknesses.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Maybe I don't see it that way.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Oh, so it's back to pretending we're human again, is it? Spare me the Uncle Tom routine. You can't keep denying what you are. You're one of us, Blade. You always have been.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You're wrong.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Am I? You think the humans will ever accept a half-breed like you? They can't. They're afraid of you.  The humans fear us because we're superior. They fear us because in their hearts they know their race has become obsolete.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: The pause that refreshes --  Care for some? Smells good, doesn't it? Pungent, with just an irrepressible hint of iron.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: You sure now? I bled a newborn for this. You won't find a drink that's sweeter.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You're not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Watch me.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: No longer.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Frost!!!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Who dies first?

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: Take him.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Guess you're not quite as invulnerable as you thought.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: You're wrong -- a few minutes more, and my transition will be complete. Even your sword won't be able to affect me then.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You don't have a few minutes, Frost.

turns.speaker: FROST
turns.text: You're too human, Blade.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It's because I'm human that I can do this.

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: Is something wrong, my friend?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You're blind --

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: There are other ways to see. Sit.

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: Hold out your hands.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I didn't come here to get my palms read. I need something translated.

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: Show me.

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: This is an old tongue, from an old world. It concerns LaMagra.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Who is LaMagra?

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: The vampire God. This speaks of His return.

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: The Day Walker's blood is a disparador -- a trigger, you see? For LaMagra's return. One need only consume it and the spirit of his ancestors will settle upon him.  "And the Sleeper will rise from the shadows anew, cleansing the world in a Tide of Blood."

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: "The Blood Tide".

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: Yes. The vampire apocalypse. It is said that all who feel its taint will succumb to the Thirst.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: How do I stop it?

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: I am tired. Dawn is coming.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: But I just got here --

turns.speaker: MIRACIA
turns.text: You've been here longer than you think.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You shouldn't be here.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I'm sorry, I --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: -- he's a vampire.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're joking --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Because you're tainted. The venom's still inside you. You could still turn on us.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What happens then?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: And you honestly expect me to believe all this?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I don't care what you believe. I saved your life once, I don't plan on making a habit of it. You want my advice, you'll be out of the city by nightfall. If you're stupid enough to stay, that's your business.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I can't just leave. I have a life here, a career --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Not anymore. You've seen one of them. You won't be allowed to live after that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I can go to the police. I have blood samples back at the hospital. I can show them.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Do it. You'll be dead before you can file the complaint.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: That's ridiculous! No one's that powerful.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How did you know?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Figured they'd send someone after you. Thought I'd wait around and see who showed up.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You used me as bait?!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It worked, didn't it?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But, he could've --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He didn't. Get over it.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: But he's a policeman --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He's a familiar. A human who works for the vampires. See this mark?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: That's a glyph, kind of like a vampire cattle brand. That means Officer Friendly here is someone's property. Any of the other vampire's try to bleed him, they'll have to answer to Friendly's owner --  This glyph belongs to Deacon Frost. We've been tracking him for a while now --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Why in God's name would anyone want to work for them?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Because they're vampire wanna-bes. If they're loyal, if they prove themselves, then their masters will turn them.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: And that's a good thing?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For some. Live forever, never get old. The ultimate high.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What are you doing?!

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Preventive medicine.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You can't do this, he's human, it's murder.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: It's war, now get the fuck out of the way!

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Look, if what you say is true, if there's a chance I could turn into one of them, then I've got no choice, do I? I have to work with you. I need to learn everything I can about them. It's the only way I'll be able to find a cure for myself.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: There is no cure.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You don't know that.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What are you looking at?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: What do you see here?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Graffiti --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Look closer.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I know this place -- it's a blood bank.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Owned by vampires. There's one of these in every major city, and just like Domino's, they always deliver.  You telling me you're ready to walk through that door?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You let him go --  An hour ago you were ready to kill a man for less, this one didn't even talk.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: He will.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Looks like we hit pay-dirt. This place is crawling with them.  See the valets over there? They're vampires. So is the doorman.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: How can you tell?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: The way they move, they way they smell --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So many of them -- I still can't believe they're real.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: There are worse things than vampires out there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Like me.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Some kind of archive --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Isn't this all a little high-tech? I thought vampires were more into cobwebs and coffins.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You've been watching too much TV. They've got their claws sunk into everything -- finance, real estate, politics. Probably own half of Downtown.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You're hurt --

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Nothing that won't heal by dawn.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: What am I injecting you with?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Serum -- it's a human hemoglobin substitute.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: It's dark in here.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: You get used to the darkness.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I can't close my eyes without hearing her scream.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Those aren't real memories. No one has that kind of recall.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: I do. I remember from day one. People staring at me, sensing I was different. Watching the fear grow in their eyes, knowing in their hearts I wasn't human.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: If you're not human, then why do you bleed like us? I've seen vampire blood, you don't have it running through your veins.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Just get out of here.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Blade --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: I made a trip to the hospital last night, borrowed some equipment.

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: For your miracle cure?

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Is he sick?

turns.speaker: BLADE
turns.text: Cancer.
